com.foreach.across.core.context.support

Class AcrossOrderSpecifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.foreach.across.core.context.support.AcrossOrderSpecifier

  • public class AcrossOrderSpecifier
extends Object
    A specifier that contains the different Across order related attributes. A global Order will take precedence when specified, if not the module index will apply and within a same module index the module order will be used.
    Since:
    3.0.0
    Author:
    Arne Vandamme
    See Also:
    AcrossOrderSpecifierComparator

    • Method Detail

      • getOrder

        public Integer getOrder(Object instance)
        Retrieve the actual order value for the instance. If the instance implements Ordered or PriorityOrdered, the runtime value will be used. Else the fixed getOrder() will be returned.
        Parameters:
        instance - to check
        Returns:
        order value

      • getOrder

        public Integer getOrder(Object instance,
                        Integer defaultValue)
        Retrieve the actual order value for the instance. If the instance implements Ordered or PriorityOrdered, the runtime value will be used. Else the fixed getOrder() will be returned.
        Parameters:
        instance - to check
        defaultValue - to return if no order specified
        Returns:
        order value

      • getOrderInModule

        public Integer getOrderInModule(Object instance)
        Retrieve the actual module order value for the instance. If the instance implements OrderedInModule, the return value of OrderedInModule.getOrderInModule() will be used. Else the fixed getOrderInModule() will be returned.
        Parameters:
        instance - to check
        Returns:
        order in module value

      • getOrderInModule

        public Integer getOrderInModule(Object instance,
                                Integer defaultValue)
        Retrieve the actual module order value for the instance. If the instance implements OrderedInModule, the return value of OrderedInModule.getOrderInModule() will be used. Else the fixed getOrderInModule() will be returned.
        Parameters:
        instance - to check
        defaultValue - to return if no order in module specified
        Returns:
        order in module value

      • getModuleIndex

        public Integer getModuleIndex(Integer defaultValue)
        Get the module index configured or return the default value.
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - to return if no module index set
        Returns:
        module index

      • toPriority

        public int toPriority()
        Calculate a single priority value based on the combination of order, module index and module order. Not the same as fallback sorting using the different parameters, but - when positive ordering values are used - can obtain the same result.

        Use this value for situations where you cannot modify the comparator (eg. event handling).

        Returns:
        priority value

      • toPriority

        public int toPriority(Object instance)
        Calculate a single priority value based on the combination of order, module index and module order. Not the same as fallback sorting using the different parameters, but - when positive ordering values are used - can obtain the same result.

        Use this value for situations where you cannot modify the comparator (eg. event handling).

        Parameters:
        instance - for which to calculate the priority
        Returns:
        priority value

      • forSources

        public static AcrossOrderSpecifier.AcrossOrderSpecifierBuilder forSources(List<Object> orderSources)
        Will attempt to resolve the order and order in module values from the annotations present on the sources. The first source will take precedence over later sources.
        Parameters:
        orderSources - to check
        Returns:
        specifier builder with possible values for order and orderInModule
